content:
Smoke Outlook for Sunday September 3, 2017

Incident: Burdette Fire Wildfire
Released: 31 min. ago

Smoke: Air Quality Alert in effect today for Missoula, Lake, and Ravalli counties. Smoke will persist this morning in the Bitterroot Valley, lifting some this afternoon. Smoke will return in areas closest to active fires this afternoon as fire activity increases; smoke will become much more widespread overnight.

Fire: Extremely hot and dry conditions will persist for one more day across the Northern Rockies. These dry conditions will combine with breezy westerly winds and an unstable atmosphere this afternoon and evening to create critical fire weather conditions across western Montana.

Other : Winds will switch by tomorrow from the west to the east, creating problematic fire weather conditions tonight into Monday. High pressure will return by Wednesday, bring back hot and dry conditions, conducive to stagnant air and smoky skies. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula City-County Health Department for detailed smoke response information (see link below).

https://www.missoulacounty.us/government/health-department/home-environment/air-quality/wildfire-smoke
